title: Smart Saving: TFSA vs. RRSP
description: Learn about Canada's two most popular tax-free ways to grow your money.

content.title: The TFSA
content.text: The Tax-Free Savings Account (TFSA) lets you save for anything (a car, a house, or a trip). You don't pay any tax on the profit you make inside this account, and you can withdraw money anytime for free.

content.title: The RRSP
content.text: The Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP) is for long-term retirement. Putting money in here can lower your annual income tax bill, but you usually pay tax later when you take the money out in retirement.

quiz.question: Which account allows you to withdraw money at any time without paying tax on the gains?
quiz.explanation: The TFSA is highly flexible, allowing tax-free withdrawals for any purpose at any time.

quiz.question: When is the best time to focus on an RRSP?
options: When you are in a high tax bracket
When you first arrive with no job
When you want to buy a TV next month
quiz.explanation: RRSPs provide a tax deduction, so they are most effective when you are earning a higher income and want to pay less tax now.
